resources.string: To use WLAN wifiap, turn it on.
WLAN wifiap can share this phone’s data Internet connection with other PC/mobile devices via WLAN.
After the WLAN wifiap is turned on, other PC/mobile devices can connect to it and start using the internet by following steps:
1. Turn on WLAN on PC/Mobile device.
2. Find “%s” in the list of WLAN networks.
3. Select “%s” and Enter “%s” in the password field.
4. Start using the Internet on PC/Mobile device.
The password must have at least 8 characters.
With Open security, any device can connect to your Mobile HotSpot and use your mobile data connection.
WLAN Calling lets you make and receive voice calls and text/multimedia messages over WLAN when your phone is connected to a WLAN network and registered with the MetroPCS network for WLAN Calling.
To enable WLAN,use the wireless control section of your Android settings menu.
How do I enable WLAN Calling?
Be default, your phone is enabled for WLAN Calling as soon as you enable the WLAN radio. WLAN Calling can be controlled from the WLAN Calling Settings.
How do I know when I am using WLAN for my calls?

When your phone associates with a WLAN network,it will automatically try to register with the MetroPCS network for WLAN Calling. Once the registration has successfully completed you will see the WLAN Calling icon in the Status Bar.You will also see the WLAN Calling icon displayed in the dialer(in place of your regular calling icon) and you will briefly see a message at the top of the screen saying,Calls will be made over WLAN.
Will calls or SMS/MMS over WLAN be charged differently than my cellular calls?
The primary benefit of WLAN Calling is to increase your coverage in locations with WLAN.Calls and messages made over WLAN will be charged like cellular calls for certain plans.
What happens if I lose WLAN coverage?

When the handset loses WLAN coverage,any active calls will drop and the phone will connect to the cellular network if possible. You will receive a prompt if your call drops due to a loss of WLAN coverage.
"This is tutorial of wi-fi calling. \"Skip\" will skip the wizard this time. \"Learn more\" will show more info about it"

"WLAN calling lets you say goodbye to spotty coverage. With WLAN calling you can send and receive calls and messages over a WLAN network using your existing T-Mobile plan. There's no special setup needed for WLAN calling. From the Settings menu,go to Wireless and Networks and connects to a WLAN networks to get started."
Once you see the WLAN Calling icon in the status bar,your phone is ready for WLAN Calling.
"To stay on a WLAN Call,remain in the range of the WLAN network.You'll get an audible beep and a screen message letting you know when a call has dropped because you have moved out of range."
Unable to receive response to NAPTR query
Unable to receive response to SRV query
Unable to receive response to A query
ePDG WLAN calling- Device is unable to resolve FQDN for the ePDG to an IP Address
Incorrect SIM card used (ex: no UICC with GBA support being used)he error will be displayed when the SIM card inserted is not GBA capable or is not a TMO SIM card
Error shown when the device experiences a Null pointer Exception error or an error local to the device before registration attempts are made
Device is not able to connect to ePDG or experiences a Null pointer error or an error local to the device before registration attempts are made
Device is unable to establish an IP sec tunnel with the ePDG for any reason other than timeout or certificate validation
Device is unable to establish a TLS connection for reasons other than certificate verifications failures. This includes timeout to TCP connection
Unable to validate the server certificate (this would happen if the URL for certificate revocation cannot be resolved to IP or the server cannot be reached in case of a firewall or captive portal)
Unable to validate the server certificate for IP sec tunnel establishment
The certificate is invalid: certificate is revoked, certificate expired
The certificate during IP sec tunnel establishment is invalid: certificate is revoked or has expired
This will happen in case of SIM card doesn’t exist (e.g. already deleted) from HLR/HSS
Non-TMO SIM in the phone or For future use, if MVNO were not allowed on our IMS network
IMPI and IMPU do not match or OTA to the SIM did not happen or MSISDN changed – change in HSS will be needed
Error would happen if username and password used instead of SIM based authentication or Unlikely scenario, but potentially happen with tablets
Based on EEIR check, handset is blacklisted
